title: Shadow of the Tomb Raider

cpu: AMD A10-7800 Radeon R7, 12 Compute Cores 4C+8G
notes:
Day 0 - (After Sept. 13 game patch Pre-release)

Proton 3.7-6 Beta - [UN-CHECK] "Use this tool ...". No launch options. 

After pressing PLAY, a warning will appear for no display adapter installed. Just click 'OK'.

TAA, BTAO, Motion Blur, Screen Space Reflections all cause blinking spots (speckles, freckles) artifacts on Lara's skin. Turn off, then other settings can be fine-tuned.

Tessellation causes black patches on some surfaces. Turn off.

No controller rumble in Linux - - - as usual. 'Run Benchmark'/(start button) does not work.

POTATO REPORTS:
LOW Potato - A10-7800/GTX 660SC. Mint 18.3 (4.15.0-34, Nvidia 396.51). 1280x720. Lowest all. Exclusive Full Screen - ON. CPU 'performance' toggled. Compsitor effects off. Benchmark Average FPS: 24.
HIGH Potato - i5-3750 (4.0 GHz set mobo)/1070 Ti SC BLACK. SteamOS beta 2.166 (Linux 4.16, Nvidia 396.54). 2560x1440. Ultra all (except noted settings w/ bugs). Exclusive Full Screen - ON. Vsync - OFF. SMAA. CPU 'performance' toggled. Steamos/BPM session. Benchmark Average FPS: 40. (Same settings @ 1920x1080 - Benchmark Average FPS: 50.)
title: Shadow of the Tomb Raider

gpu: X.Org AMD Radeon (TM) RX 480 Graphics (POLARIS10, DRM 3.26.0, 4.18.6-arch1-1-ARCH, LLVM 7.0.0)
notes:
Game requires DXVK 0.72. No rendering issues on RADV.
Game complains that there is no display adapter before showing the launcher, but this warning can be ignored.
title: Shadow of the Tomb Raider

notes:
Requires upgrading to dxvk 0.72 to fix some graphical artifacts.

4k has noticeable issues with scene transitions and isn't really playable.  Plays much smoother at 1080p (60fps generally with the occasional hiccup).  There is also a beta build for the game that seems to have some performance improvements.

Complains about lack of display adapter and "Tomb raider servers are unavailable" so networked functionality may not work.

Resolution: 1920x1080
Anti-Aliasing: SMAA (other modes cause artifacts)
Texture Quality: Ultra
Texture Filtering: 16x Anisotropic
Shadow Quality: Ultra
Ambient Occlusion: HBAO+ (the other mode had artifacts, off worked too)
Depth of Field: High
Level of Detail: Ultra
Tessellation: On
Bloom: On
Motion Blur: OFF (spots on skin with ON)
Screen Space Reflections: OFF (spots on skin with ON)
Screen Space Contact Shadows: High
Pure Hair: Normal
Volumetric Lighting: On
Lens Flares: On
Screen Effects: On
title: Shadow of the Tomb Raider

notes:
Definitely requires upgrading to the latest dxvk - and nvidia beta drivers -  to reach playability at this time. Graphically, the game works well on my system with the following settings: 
Exclusive Fullscreen - ON, 
Resolution - 1920x1080,
Vsync - ON,
AA - SMAA (other settings still cause artifacting),
Texture Quality - High,
Texture Filtering - 16x Anisotropic,
Shadow Quality - High,
Depth of Field - High,
Level of Detail - High,
Ambient Occlusion - HBAO+,
Pure Hair - Normal,
Screen Space Contact Shadows - High,
Motion Blur - OFF (causes issues),
Bloom - ON,
Screen Space Reflections - OFF (causes issues),
Lens Flares - ON,
Screen Effects - ON,
Volumetric Lighting - ON,
Tessellation - ON.

Note: This yields an FPS average of ~40, where running in windows gave me a near-solid 60 in most locations with settings on ultra - most likely due to DX12 (on Windows) and the fact that we are invoking a compatibility layer. Temper your expectations accordingly.

The games is still not faithfully reproduced in it's entirety as there are some bugs here that are not present in Windows - most notably the directionality of sound is not always correct and certain dialog options take upward of 20 seconds to begin once the button is pressed.

All in all, very minor bugs - I expect this game will be Gold, and then Platinum, very soon.
title: Shadow of the Tomb Raider

notes: Crashes randomly - Maybe downgrading the videodriver may help.

gpu: X.Org Radeon RX 580 Series (POLARIS10, DRM 3.23.0, 4.15.0-36-generic, LLVM 7.0.0)
notes:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9MDeHKEsX1g

Selected High preset then manually tweaked Texture Quality to Ultra, set 16x AF, and disabled Motion Blur. Played from the beginning up to the 1st save point in the jungle and frame rate ranges from 40 FPS to 50 FPS. There is stuttering when loading a new area of a level. Game is playable and there are no graphical glitches and no game crashes.
title: Shadow of the Tomb Raider

notes: Some issue requires disabling certain settings, however it does not impact visual quality much. Performance, I seem to be hitting a pretty hard CPU bottleneck (go figure right with a R3 1200 >_< I swear it is because I am waiting for Zen 2). Run using post 0.71 DXVK version. Furthermore, tesselation lead to significant performance loss. Yet again, might just be my cpu reaching its limits. I assume it is a cpu bottleneck due to similar performance at any quality setting and low (40%) utilisation on a 1070 ti getting anywhere from 19 - 100 fps although In villages I settle more around the mid 40's.
title: Shadow of the Tomb Raider

notes: The following Settings cause Lara to have weird artifacts on her skin and must be turned off: BTAO, Motion Blur, Screen Space Reflections, TAA. Runs wonderfully otherwise.
title: Shadow of the Tomb Raider
